intro: Cochleariella zhejiangensis, commonly known as the Zhejiang cochleariella, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage consists of finely divided leaves, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native region.
